value.name: 5 juveniles have been fatally shot by police in Columbus since 2016. Here's a look at their cases
value.description: According to the Mapping Police Violence project, only in Chicago have more teenagers been fatally shot by police since 2013. Here are the Columbus cases.

value.name: Police shootings of children spark new outcry, calls for training to deal with adolescents in crisis
value.description: A Washington Post database of fatal force incidents finds most children shot by police are minorities and less likely to be armed than adults shot by police.

value.name: Columbus police trail only Chicago in fatal shootings of juveniles since 2013
value.description: Since 2013, when Mapping Police Violence statistics began, only Chicago police have fatally shot more juveniles than Columbus police.

value.name: Police shootings of children spark renewed calls for training on adolescents in crisis
value.description: The 2016 fatal shooting of 13-year-old Tyre King falls into this category. Like Bryant, the Black teen was fatally shot by a Columbus officer. The officer, Bryan Mason, said the teen was reaching ...
